meanings.definition: To price (something) below its actual value.
meanings.sent1: She decided to underpricing her handmade jewelry to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The store often underpricings its products to compete with online retailers.
meanings.sent3: The magician underpricing his tricks made everyone believe they were real gold.
meanings.sent4: The artist underpricing her paintings was like giving them away for free.
meanings.sent5: The student underpricing his skills in the exam got him a lower grade than he deserved.

meanings.definition: The act of setting a price lower than the market value.
meanings.sent1: The underpricing of the new smartphone led to a rush of buyers.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was partly due to their clever underpricing strategy.
meanings.sent3: The underpricing of the concert tickets caused a frenzy among music fans.
meanings.sent4: The underpricing of the antique vase made it a steal for the buyer.
meanings.sent5: The underpricing of the house attracted many potential buyers looking for a bargain.
